net.jxta.content
Interface ContentProviderListener

All Superinterfaces:
EventListener
All Known Implementing Classes:
EventAggregator
public interface ContentProviderListener
extends EventListener

Interface provided to notify interested parties of ContentProvider events which may be useful to them. This can be used by the application to centralize monitoring hooks, allowing the application to (for example) maintain asynchronously updated lists of current shares and/or automatically perform remote publishing of new advertisements.

Implementors should take note that even if a listener is added to a single provider, events may arrive from multiple providers. This is due to the fact that some providers (the one to which the listener was added in this scenario) may be aggregations of multiple underlying provider implementations, as is the case with the ContentService implementation. Unless the event source is explicitly checked the consumer should not make any assumptions relating to the arrival order of the events, etc..

Method Summary
 void contentShared(ContentProviderEvent event)
          Called when Content is publicly shared by a provider.
 boolean contentSharesFound(ContentProviderEvent event)
          Called when shares are found as the result of a call to the ContentProvider's findContentShares() method, and only called against the listener specified as an argument to the method.
 void contentUnshared(ContentProviderEvent event)
          Called when an existing ContentShare is no longer publicly shared by a provider.

contentUnshared

void contentUnshared(ContentProviderEvent event)

contentSharesFound

boolean contentSharesFound(ContentProviderEvent event)
Called when shares are found as the result of a call to the ContentProvider's findContentShares() method, and only called against the listener specified as an argument to the method.

Parameters:
event - content provider event object
Returns:
true if the listing request should continue, false to cancel this request and prevent further processing
